Chatbots must parse sentences to understand 'I want hotpot' versus 'I hate hotpot'.
Python can parse CSV files faster than you can say 'pandas'.
The app parses your shopping list into categories: snacks, instant noodles, and more snacks.
The algorithm parsed out 20 slang terms from livestream comments.

examples.sentence: The parsimonious professor reused tea bags until they turned white.
Her parsimonious habit of saving used toothpicks made her family groan.
The parsimonious landlord charged tenants for breathing his hallway air.
His parsimonious tipping made waiters spill drinks 'accidentally'.
He's parsimonious with compliments but generous with criticism.
His parsimony reached the point of reusing tea bags for a week.
The billionaire's parsimony with air conditioning shocked his staff.
The landlord's parsimony in building maintenance caused the pipes to burst.
Her parsimony with compliments made her praise truly valuable.
The poet's parsimony with words created stunning minimalism.
Academic writing values parsimony over verbosity.
Scientists use the principle of parsimony to choose the simplest explanation.
The chef garnished the steak with curly parsley like green confetti.
Parsley in hotpot dipping sauce is the soul of Chongqing style.
Flat-leaf parsley is essential for authentic tabbouleh salad.
She grows Italian parsley in her balcony herb garden.
French parsley soup tastes like spring in a bowl.
The roasted parsnip tastes like a sweet potato with nutty flavor.
Her secret stew recipe includes parsnips and star anise.
Parsnips were used as natural sweeteners before sugar became widely available.
The white carrot-shaped parsnip is actually a cousin of celery.
Beware of wild parsnip sap which can cause skin burns under sunlight.
The parson grows organic vegetables in the churchyard.
Our parson plays heavy metal guitar after Sunday service.
Grandpa always fights me for the parson's nose of the roast duck.
The old parsonage by the church has a haunted attic according to villagers.
They serve afternoon tea in the parsonage's rose garden every Sunday.
The new parsonage comes with a built-in Bible study room.
A stray cat permanently resides in the parsonage's kitchen.
The spicy part of hotpot is always gone first.
The best part of my job is free milk tea.
My bike needs a new chain part.
He played the part of a drunken poet.
Use chopsticks to part the stinky tofu into smaller pieces.
They parted at the subway station after 3 years together.
I only have part knowledge about Peking Opera.
The movie is part funny and part scary.
Laziness plays a part in my unfinished homework.
For the most part, pandas just eat and sleep.
The whole team will partake in the Dragon Boat Festival race.
Foreign students actively partake in Chinese paper-cutting workshops.
Roommates should partake household chores equally.
All departments must partake the responsibility for this project.
Let's partake this giant hotpot with 10 different broths!
The billionaire partakes his success stories on Douyin.
We invited the neighbors to partake in our mooncake festival.
Tourists can partake of local delicacies at the night market.
Over 50 countries will partake in the Winter Olympics.
Young people are encouraged to partake in community services.
This dish partakes of both Sichuan and Hunan flavors.
His speech partakes of ancient Chinese philosophy.
Millions netizens partake in the annual Singles' Day shopping spree.
This novel partakes of both mystery and romance genres.

examples.sentence: The Red Sea's parted waves in biblical stories look like a giant zipper.
Her parted bangs reveal a forehead sticker of Nezha.
The Peking opera performer's parted lips signaled the next high note.
The peony parterre in Luoyang becomes a sea of pink every April.
She designed a zodiac-themed parterre with 12 herbal plants.
We got parterre seats for the Peking Opera at surprisingly low prices.
The acoustics in the parterre are perfect for appreciating guqin music.
The parterre box offers both floral scent and stage view.
The influencer only gave a partial refund for the defective face cream.
Our team achieved partial success in the AI chatbot project.
The judge was accused of being partial to the celebrity defendant.
No teacher should be partial to students who bring them gifts.
I'm partial to stinky tofu with extra chili sauce.
Grandma is partial to her youngest grandson who studies medicine.
This flute can produce both fundamental tones and partials.
The overtone singing technique emphasizes the upper partials.
Chinese tourists are partial to luxury shopping in Paris.
We watched the partial solar eclipse through smoked glass.
